description.undefined: This ontology provides the terminologies used for positioning systems.

abstract.value: The positioning system ontology is a vocabulary for describing positioning systems and the techniques these systems use to determine a position. With POSO we aim to provide semantic meaning on how a positioning system is deployed and how results are calculated.

bibliographicCitation.value: Maxim Van de Wynckel and Beat Signer, POSO: A Generic Positioning System Ontology

definition.value:
Describes normal OperatingProperties of a System under some specified Conditions. For example, to the power requirement or maintenance schedule of a System under a specified temperature range.

    In the absence of OperatingProperties, it simply describes the Conditions in which a System is expected to operate.

    The System continues to operate as defined using SystemCapability. If, however, the SurvivalRange is violated, the System is 'damaged' and SystemCapability specifications may no longer hold.

comment.en:
Describes normal OperatingProperties of a System under some specified Conditions. For example, to the power requirement or maintenance schedule of a System under a specified temperature range.

    In the absence of OperatingProperties, simply describes the Conditions in which a System is expected to operate.

    The System continues to operate as defined using SystemCapability. If, however, the SurvivalRange is violated, the System is 'damaged' and SystemCapability specifications may no longer hold.

definition.value:
As a Sensor Property: the smallest difference in the value of a ObservableProperty being observed that would result in perceptably different values of Observation Results, under the defined Conditions.

      As an Actuator Property: the smallest difference in the value of an Actuation command that would result in a value change of the ActuatableProperty being acted on, under the defined Conditions.

comment.en:
As a Sensor Property: the smallest difference in the value of a ObservableProperty being observed that would result in perceptably different values of Observation Results, under the defined Conditions. 

      As an Actuator Property: the smallest difference in the value of an Actuation command that would result in a value change of the ActuatableProperty being acted on, under the defined Conditions.
Describes the deployment of a System in an outdoor environment.

example.value: An example of cell identification is using the position of a QR-code when this code is scanned (and the user is presumably within a short distance).
An example of cell identification is using the position of a Bluetooth beacon whenever this beacon has a high signal strength.

comment.en: Cell identification is a positioning procedure using the position of one landmark that is within the cell.

definition.value: Act of carrying out an (Observation) Procedure to estimate or calculate a value of a property of a FeatureOfInterest. Links to a Sensor to describe what made the Observation and how; links to an ObservableProperty to describe what the result is an estimate of, and to a FeatureOfInterest to detail what that property was associated with.

example.value: The activity of estimating the intensity of an Earthquake using the Mercalli intensity scale is an Observation as is measuring the moment magnitude, i.e., the energy released by said earthquake.

comment.en: Act of carrying out an (Observation) Procedure to estimate or calculate a value of a property of a FeatureOfInterest. Links to a Sensor to describe what made the Observation and how; links to an ObservableProperty to describe what the result is an estimate of, and to a FeatureOfInterest to detail what that property was associated with.
A positioning technique is a procedure to sample sensor data to an output position.

definition.value: Any information that is reported from a Procedure.

comment.en: Any information that is reported from a Procedure.

definition.value:
Describes normal measurement, actuation, sampling properties such as accuracy, range, precision, etc. of a System under some specified Conditions such as a temperature range.

    The capabilities specified here are those that affect the primary purpose of the System, while those in OperatingRange represent the system's normal operating environment, including conditions that don't affect the observations or the actuations.

comment.en:
Describes normal measurement, actuation, sampling properties such as accuracy, range, precision, etc. of a System under some specified Conditions such as a temperature range.

    The capabilities specified here are those that affect the primary purpose of the System, while those in OperatingRange represent the system's normal operating environment, including conditions that don't affect the observations or the actuations.

An inertial positioning system is a positioning system employing accelerometers, gyroscopes, and computer as integral components to determine coordinates of points or objects relative to an initial known reference point

definition.value: An identifiable and observable characteristic that represents the System's ability to operate its primary purpose: a Sensor to make Observations, an Actuator to make Actuations, or a Sampler to make Samplings.

comment.en: An identifiable and observable characteristic that represents the System's ability to operate its primary purpose: a Sensor to make Observations, an Actuator to make Actuations, or a Sampler to make Samplings.

definition.value: The set of values that the Sensor can return as the Result of an Observation under the defined Conditions.

comment.en: The set of values that the Sensor can return as the Result of an Observation under the defined Conditions.

definition.value:
As a Sensor Property: the time between a (step) change in the value of an observed ObservableProperty and a Sensor (possibly with specified error) 'settling' on an observed value, under the defined Conditions.

      As an Actuator property: the time between a (step) change in the command of an Actuator and the 'settling' of the value of the acted on ActuatableProperty, under the defined Conditions.

comment.en:
As a Sensor Property: the time between a (step) change in the value of an observed ObservableProperty and a Sensor (possibly with specified error) 'settling' on an observed value, under the defined Conditions.

      As an Actuator property: the time between a (step) change in the command of an Actuator and the 'settling' of the value of the acted on ActuatableProperty, under the defined Conditions.

definition.value:
As a Sensor Property: a continuous or incremental change in the reported values of Observations over time for an unchanging Property under the defined Conditions.

      As an Actuator Property: a continuous or incremental change in the true value of the acted on ActuatableProperty over time for an unchanging command under the defined Conditions.

comment.en:
As a Sensor Property: a continuous or incremental change in the reported values of Observations over time for an unchanging Property under the defined Conditions. 

      As an Actuator Property: a continuous or incremental change in the true value of the acted on ActuatableProperty over time for an unchanging command under the defined Conditions.

definition.value: An actuatable quality (property, characteristic) of a FeatureOfInterest.

example.value: A window actuator acts by changing the state between a frame and a window. The ability of the window to be opened and closed is its ActuatableProperty.

comment.en: An actuatable quality (property, characteristic) of a FeatureOfInterest.
The radio propagation formulas cover the computation of the radio waves through a medium (e.g. air).
A positioning system is a system of instrumental and computational components for determining position.
Odometry is the Procedure of calculating the current position of a moving FeatureOfInterest by using its previous position and Sensor Observation's indicating its heading and velocity.

definition.value: A quality of an entity. An aspect of an entity that is intrinsic to and cannot exist without the entity.

comment.en: A quality of an entity. An aspect of an entity that is intrinsic to and cannot exist without the entity.

definition.value:
As a Sensor Property: Sensitivity is the quotient of the change in a Result of Observation and the corresponding change in a value of an ObservableProperty being observed, under the defined Conditions.

       As an Actuator Property: Sensitivity is the quotient of the change in a command of Actuation and the corresponding change in a value of an ActuatableProperty being acted on, under the defined Conditions.

comment.en:
As a Sensor Property: Sensitivity is the quotient of the change in a Result of Observation and the corresponding change in a value of an ObservableProperty being observed, under the defined Conditions.

       As an Actuator Property: Sensitivity is the quotient of the change in a command of Actuation and the corresponding change in a value of an ActuatableProperty being acted on, under the defined Conditions.

definition.value: Total useful life of a System's battery in the specified Conditions.

comment.en: Total useful life of a System's battery in the specified Conditions.
A positioning platform is a framework, architecture or platform used to develop and host a positioning system.
Angular velocity is the momentum around a point of origin.

definition.value: An identifiable characteristic that represents how the System operates under the specified Conditions. May describe power ranges, power sources, standard configurations, attachments and the like.

comment.en: An identifiable characteristic that represents how the System operates under the specified Conditions. May describe power ranges, power sources, standard configurations, attachments and the like.
Linear movement along a certain axis.

Fingerprinting is a positioning Procedure where sensor data is collected at a specific position and orientation. During the offline-stage of a positioning system, the significant data features are extracted and stored for that position. In the online-stage, the closest match(es) of the features are determined to predict the position.
Linear or angular velocity of a feature.
The orientation of a feature of interest in 2D or 3D space.
comment.nl: De orientatie van een object in 2D of 3D.

definition.value: The smallest possible time between one Observation, Actuation, or Sampling and the next, under the defined Conditions.

comment.en: The smallest possible time between one Observation, Actuation, or Sampling and the next, under the defined Conditions.

definition.value:
As a Sensor Property: the closeness of agreement between replicate Observations on an unchanged or similar Property value: i.e., a measure of a Sensor's ability to consistently reproduce an Observation, under the defined Conditions.

      As an Actuator Property: the closeness of agreement between replicate Actuations for an unchanged or similar command: i.e., a measure of an Actuator's ability to consistently reproduce an Actuation, under the defined Conditions.

comment.en:
As a Sensor Property: the closeness of agreement between replicate Observations on an unchanged or similar Property value: i.e., a measure of a Sensor's ability to consistently reproduce an Observation, under the defined Conditions.

      As an Actuator Property: the closeness of agreement between replicate Actuations for an unchanged or similar command: i.e., a measure of an Actuator's ability to consistently reproduce an Actuation, under the defined Conditions.
An identifiable and observable spatial reference system that represents the System's ability to operate its primary purpose in a specified reference system.

definition.value: An Actuation carries out an (Actuation) Procedure to change the state of the world using an Actuator.

example.value: The activity of automatically closing a window if the temperature in a room drops below 20 degree Celsius. The activity is the Actuation and the device that closes the window is the Actuator. The Procedure is the rule, plan, or specification that defines the conditions that triggers the Actuation, here a drop in temperature.

comment.en: An Actuation carries out an (Actuation) Procedure to change the state of the world using an Actuator.
Angular movement around a certain origin point.
An absolute position describes the position of an entity based on a fixed point in space. Usually this space is the Earth and the position is expressed in latitude and longitude.
A relative velocity is a quantitative velocity relative to another feature of interest.
The axis-angle orientation is an orientation representation where the x, y and z values are rotated with a certain angle.

definition.value: System is a unit of abstraction for pieces of infrastructure that implement Procedures. A System may have components, its subsystems, which are other systems.

comment.en: System is a unit of abstraction for pieces of infrastructure that implement Procedures. A System may have components, its subsystems, which are other systems.
A spatial landmark that can be observed by sound.

definition.value: Device, agent (including humans), or software (simulation) involved in, or implementing, a Procedure. Sensors respond to a stimulus, e.g., a change in the environment, or input data composed from the results of prior Observations, and generate a Result. Sensors can be hosted by Platforms.

example.value: Accelerometers, gyroscopes, barometers, magnetometers, and so forth are Sensors that are typically mounted on a modern smart phone (which acts as Platform). Other examples of sensors include the human eyes.

comment.en: Device, agent (including humans), or software (simulation) involved in, or implementing, a Procedure. Sensors respond to a stimulus, e.g., a change in the environment, or input data composed from the results of prior Observations, and generate a Result. Sensors can be hosted by Platforms.
A position indicates where an entity is located.
Mid-Level sensor fusion is about fusing the objects detected independently on sensor data.

In this context, satellite positioning implies the use of radio signals transmitted from "active" artificial objects orbiting the Earth and received by "passive" instruments on or near the Earth's surface to determine position, velocity, and/or attitude of an object.
An optical positioning system is a positioning system that determines the position of an object by means of the properties of light.
High level sensor fusion is about fusing both objects and their trajectories. We're not only relying on detections, but also on predictions and tracking.

definition.value: An observed value for which the probability of falsely claiming the absence of a component in a material is beta, given a probability alpha of falsely claiming its presence.

comment.en: An observed value for which the probability of falsely claiming the absence of a component in a material is beta, given a probability alpha of falsely claiming its presence.

definition.value: Schedule of maintenance for a System in the specified Conditions.

comment.en: Schedule of maintenance for a System in the specified Conditions.

definition.value: A device that is used by, or implements, an (Actuation) Procedure that changes the state of the world.

example.value: A window actuator for automatic window control, i.e., opening or closing the window.

comment.en: A device that is used by, or implements, an (Actuation) Procedure that changes the state of the world.

definition.value: The set of values that the Actuator can return as the Result of an Actuation under the defined Conditions with the defined system properties.

comment.en: The set of values that the Actuator can return as the Result of an Actuation under the defined Conditions with the defined system properties.

definition.value: An event in the real world that 'triggers' the Sensor. The properties associated to the Stimulus may be different to the eventual observed ObservableProperty. It is the event, not the object, that triggers the Sensor.

comment.en: An event in the real world that 'triggers' the Sensor. The properties associated to the Stimulus may be different to the eventual observed ObservableProperty. It is the event, not the object, that triggers the Sensor.
Magnetic field odometry is the procedure of detecting movement by analyizing how the magnetic field is changing from one Observation to another.
Dead reckoning is the Procedure of calculating the current position of a moving FeatureOfInterest by using its previous position and Sensor Observation's indicating its heading and velocity.

definition.value: An act of Sampling carries out a sampling Procedure to create or transform one or more samples.

example.value: Drilling an observation well.
Selecting a subset of a population.
Sieving a powder to separate the subset finer than 100-mesh.
Digging a pit through a soil sequence.
Crushing a rock sample in a ball mill.
Taking a diamond-drill core from a rock outcrop.
Establishing a station for environmental monitoring.
Splitting a piece of drill-core to create two new samples.
Drawing blood from a patient.
Registering an image of the landscape.
Dividing a field site into quadrants.

comment.en: An act of Sampling carries out a sampling Procedure to create or transform one or more samples.
Visual odometry is the procedure of detecting movement by analyzing how visual features are moving from one Observation image frame to another.

definition.value: The time between a command for an Observation (resp. Actuation) and the Sensor providing a Result (resp. the Actuator operating the Actuation), under the defined Conditions.

comment.en: The time between a command for an Observation (resp. Actuation) and the Sensor providing a Result (resp. the Actuator operating the Actuation), under the defined Conditions.

definition.value: Describes the Deployment of one or more Systems for a particular purpose. Deployment may be done on a Platform.

example.value: For example, a temperature Sensor deployed on a wall, or a whole network of Sensors deployed for an Observation campaign.

comment.en: Describes the Deployment of one or more Systems for a particular purpose. Deployment may be done on a Platform.

definition.value: The closeness of agreement between the Result of an Observation (resp. the command of an Actuation) and the true value of the observed ObservableProperty (resp. of the acted on ActuatableProperty) under the defined Conditions.

comment.en: The closeness of agreement between the Result of an Observation (resp. the command of an Actuation) and the true value of the observed ObservableProperty (resp. of the acted on ActuatableProperty) under the defined Conditions.

definition.value: The Result of an Observation, Actuation, or act of Sampling. To store an observation's simple result value one can use the hasSimpleResult property.

example.value: The value 20 as the height of a certain tree together with the unit, e.g., Meter.

comment.en: The Result of an Observation, Actuation, or act of Sampling. To store an observation's simple result value one can use the hasSimpleResult property.

note.value: Many observations may be created via the same Procedure, the same way as many tables are assembled using the same instructions (as information objects, not their concrete realization).

definition.value: A workflow, protocol, plan, algorithm, or computational method specifying how to make an Observation, create a Sample, or make a change to the state of the world (via an Actuator). A Procedure is re-usable, and might be involved in many Observations, Samplings, or Actuations. It explains the steps to be carried out to arrive at reproducible results.

example.value: The measured wind speed differs depending on the height of the sensor above the surface, e.g., due to friction. Consequently, procedures for measuring wind speed define a standard height for anemometers above ground, typically 10m for meteorological measures and 2m in Agrometeorology. This definition of height, sensor placement, and so forth are defined by the Procedure.

comment.en: A workflow, protocol, plan, algorithm, or computational method specifying how to make an Observation, create a Sample, or make a change to the state of the world (via an Actuator). A Procedure is re-usable, and might be involved in many Observations, Samplings, or Actuations. It explains the steps to be carried out to arrive at reproducible results.
An integrated positioning system is a positioning system that incorporates multiple positioning technologies.

example.value: An example of relative angle is the Angle of Arrival.

comment.en: A relative angle is a quantitative angle relative to another feature of interest.

example.value: An RF landmark example is a Bluetooth beacon that sends out a signal. Receivers of this signal can use the known position of this landmark to determine their relative position.

comment.en: A radio frequency landmark is a transmitting landmark that can be observed by its transmitting signals.
A relative position is a position of a feature of interest with respect to the positions of other objects that this position is relative to.
comment.nl: Een relatieve positie is een positie van een punt, met respect tot de posities van andere objecten die relatief zijn.

note.value: A transient sample, such as a ships-track or flight-line, might be identified and described, but is unlikely to be revisited exactly.

definition.value: Feature which is intended to be representative of a FeatureOfInterest on which Observations may be made.

example.value: A 'station' is essentially an identifiable locality where a sensor system or Procedure may be deployed and an observation made. In the context of the observation model, it connotes the 'world in the vicinity of the station', so the observed properties relate to the physical medium at the station, and not to any physical artifact such as a mooring, buoy, benchmark, monument, well, etc.

A statistical sample is often designed to be characteristic of an entire population, so that observations can be made regarding the sample that provide a good estimate of the properties of the population.

comment.en: Physical samples are sometimes known as 'specimens'.

definition.value: An identifiable characteristic that represents the extent of the System's useful life under the specified Conditions. May describe for example total battery life or number of recharges, or, for Sensors that are used only a fixed number of times, the number of observations that can be made before the sensing capability is depleted.

comment.en: An identifiable characteristic that represents the extent of the System's useful life under the specified Conditions. May describe for example total battery life or number of recharges, or, for Sensors that are used only a fixed number of times, the number of observations that can be made before the sensing capability is depleted.

definition.value:
As a Sensor Property: Selectivity is a Property of a Sensor whereby it provides observed values for one or more ObservableProperties such that the Results for each ObservableProperty are independent of other Properties in the FeatureOfInterest being investigated,  under the defined Conditions.

      As an Actuator Property: Selectivity is a Property of an Actuator whereby it acts on one or more ActuatableProperties such as the Results for each ActuatableProperty are independent of other Properties in the FeatureOfInterest being acted on, under the defined Conditions.

comment.en:
As a Sensor Property: Selectivity is a Property of a Sensor whereby it provides observed values for one or more ObservableProperties such that the Results for each ObservableProperty are independent of other Properties in the FeatureOfInterest being investigated,  under the defined Conditions.

      As an Actuator Property: Selectivity is a Property of an Actuator whereby it acts on one or more ActuatableProperties such as the Results for each ActuatableProperty are independent of other Properties in the FeatureOfInterest being acted on, under the defined Conditions.
Triangulation is the procedure of determining a position using relative angles to a feature of interest with a known position.

definition.value: Total useful life of a System (expressed as total life since manufacture, time in use, number of operations, etc.) in the specified Conditions.

comment.en: Total useful life of a System (expressed as total life since manufacture, time in use, number of operations, etc.) in the specified Conditions.

A location based service (LBS) is a service that provides the location of a person or object. It provides this information without the required knowledge of the underlying technologies and algorithms.

definition.value: Power range in which a System is expected to operate in the specified Conditions.

comment.en: Power range in which a System is expected to operate in the specified Conditions.
A fingerprint is a scene analysis at a particular absolute position.
Describes the spatial deployment of a System in an indoor environment.
A visual landmark is a feature of interest that visually present in the space.

definition.value: Used to specify ranges for qualities that act as conditions on a system/sensor's operation.  For example, wind speed of 10-60m/s may be used as the condition on a SystemProperty, for example, to state that a sensor has a particular accuracy in that condition.

comment.en: Used to specify ranges for qualities that act as conditions on a system/sensor's operation.  For example, wind speed of 10-60m/s may be used as the condition on a SystemProperty, for example, to state that a sensor has a particular accuracy in that condition.
Multilateration is the procedure of determining a position using relative distances to other known positions.
A landmark is a feature with a known position, that can be used to identify the position of an object that has a relative position with this feature.
Sensor fusion is a procedure where multiple sensor data is combined to obtain a more reliable or accurate result.
Movement stimulus triggering an update of a position.

Pedestrian dead reckoning (PDR) is a positioning technique where the object is assumed to be a pedestrian that is walking or running. Using this knowledge, the dead reckoning involves the detection of steps and the step length to more accurately predict the movement.
Angulation is a triangulation method to determine a position based on the relative angles to other objects.

example.value: The phone of a person that is being tracked in an indoor positioning system is the tracked feature.

comment.en: A feature of interest that is being tracked by a positioning system. This is the feature for which a position is observed.

Simultaneous localization and mapping (SLAM) is the computational problem of constructing or updating a map of an unknown environment while simultaneously keeping track of an agent's location within it.

definition.value: An observable quality (property, characteristic) of a FeatureOfInterest.

example.value: The height of a tree, the depth of a water body, or the temperature of a surface are examples of observable properties, while the value of a classic car is not (directly) observable but asserted.

comment.en: An observable quality (property, characteristic) of a FeatureOfInterest.
Linear velocity is the momentum along one ore more axis.

definition.value:
Describes SurvivalProperties of a System under some specified Conditions. For example, the lifetime of a System under a specified temperature range.

    In the absence of SurvivalProperties, simply describes the Conditions a System can be exposed to without damage. For example, the temperature range a System can withstand before being considered damaged.

    The System continues to operate as defined using SystemCapability. If, however, the SurvivalRange is violated, the System is 'damaged' and SystemCapability specifications may no longer hold.

comment.en:
Describes survival capabilities of a System under some specified Conditions. For example, to the lifetime of a System under a specified temperature range.

    In the absence of SurvivalProperties, simply describes the Conditions a System can be exposed to without damage. For example, the temperature range a System can withstand before being considered damaged.

    The System continues to operate as defined using SystemCapability. If, however, the OperatingProperty is violated, the System is operating 'out of operating range' and SystemCapability specifications may no longer hold.

A Bluetooth beacon is an RF landmark that advertises its transmission power and other optional information. Based on the signal strength receivers of this advertisement can determine the approximate distance.

Visual simultaneous localisation and mapping (VSLAM) is a positioning techniques that uses visual imagery to map an environment. Positioning works by detecting features of interest in image frames and comparing how these features move from one frame to another.

definition.value: A device that is used by, or implements, a Sampling Procedure to create or transform one or more samples.

example.value: A ball mill, diamond drill, hammer, hypodermic syringe and needle, image Sensor or a soil auger can all act as sampling devices (i.e., be Samplers). However, sometimes the distinction between the Sampler and the Sensor is not evident, as they are packaged as a unit. A Sampler need not be a physical device.

comment.en: A device that is used by, or implements, a Sampling Procedure to create or transform one or more samples.
Acceleration is the (instantaneous) rate of change of velocity.

definition.value: A Platform is an entity that hosts other entities, particularly Sensors, Actuators, Samplers, and other Platforms.

example.value: A post, buoy, vehicle, ship, aircraft, satellite, cell-phone, human or animal may act as platforms for (technical or biological) sensors or actuators.

comment.en: A Platform is an entity that hosts other entities, particularly Sensors, Actuators, Samplers, and other Platforms.

definition.value: The thing whose property is being estimated or calculated in the course of an Observation to arrive at a Result or whose property is being manipulated by an Actuator, or which is being sampled or transformed in an act of Sampling.

example.value: When measuring the height of a tree, the height is the observed ObservableProperty, 20m may be the Result of the Observation, and the tree is the FeatureOfInterest. A window is a FeatureOfInterest for an automatic window control Actuator.

comment.en: The thing whose property is being estimated or calculated in the course of an Observation to arrive at a Result or whose property is being manipulated by an Actuator, or which is being sampled or transformed in an act of Sampling.
Low Level Sensor Fusion is about fusing the raw data coming from multiple sensors. For example, we fuse point clouds coming from LiDARs and pixels coming from cameras.

definition.value: Any information that is provided to a Procedure for its use.

comment.en: Any information that is provided to a Procedure for its use.
A positioning system that is meant to perform indoor positioning of a feature of interest.
A relative distance is a quantitative distance relative to another feature of interest.

definition.value: A relation between a FeatureOfInterest and an Observation about it, an Actuation acting on it, or an act of Sampling that sampled it.

comment.en: A relation between a FeatureOfInterest and an Observation about it, an Actuation acting on it, or an act of Sampling that sampled it.
Yaw is the rotation around the z-axis with respect to the object the yaw applies to.
Indicates the orientation of a feature of interest.
comment.nl: Duid de orientatie aan van een object aan.

comment.en: Quantitative result value along the Y-axis of a spatial sensor or result.
Indicates the absolute or relative position of a feature of interest.
comment.nl: Duid de absolute of relatieve positie van een object aan.

example.value: http://www.opengis.net/def/crs/OGC/1.3/CRS84

comment.en: Identifies an entity that has a spatial reference system in order to interpret the result.

definition.value: A relation between an Observation and the entity whose quality was observed, or between an Actuation and the entity whose property was modified, or between an act of Sampling and the entity that was sampled.

example.value: For example, in an Observation of the weight of a person, the FeatureOfInterest is the person and the property is its weight.

comment.en: A relation between an Observation and the entity whose quality was observed, or between an Actuation and the entity whose property was modified, or between an act of Sampling and the entity that was sampled.
The relation between a system and an observable property class to identify that a system observes a specific type of property.

definition.value: The time that the Result of an Observation, Actuation or Sampling applies to the FeatureOfInterest. Not necessarily the same as the resultTime. May be an Interval or an Instant, or some other compound TemporalEntity.

comment.en: The time that the Result of an Observation, Actuation or Sampling applies to the FeatureOfInterest. Not necessarily the same as the resultTime. May be an Interval or an Instant, or some other compound TemporalEntity.
Pitch is the rotation around the x-axis with respect to the object the yaw applies to.
Quantitative result value along the X-axis of a spatial sensor or result.

definition.value: Relation linking an Observation or Actuation or act of Sampling and a Result or Sample.

comment.en: Relation linking an Observation or Actuation or act of Sampling and a Result or Sample.
Quantitative result value along the Z-axis of a spatial sensor.

definition.value: A relation between an Observation and the entity whose quality was observed, or between an Actuation and the entity whose property was modified, or between an act of Sampling and the entity that was sampled.

example.value: For example, in an Observation of the weight of a person, the FeatureOfInterest is the person and the property is its weight.

comment.en: A relation between an Observation and the entity whose quality was observed, or between an Actuation and the entity whose property was modified, or between an act of Sampling and the entity that was sampled.

definition.value: A relation to link to a re-usable Procedure used in making an Observation, an Actuation, or a Sample, typically through a Sensor, Actuator or Sampler.

comment.en: A relation to link to a re-usable Procedure used in making an Observation, an Actuation, or a Sample, typically through a Sensor, Actuator or Sampler.

definition.value: Relation linking a Result to the Observation or Actuation or act of Sampling that created or caused it.

comment.en: Relation linking a Result to the Observation or Actuation or act of Sampling that created or caused it.

definition.value: Relation from a Sample to the FeatureOfInterest that it is intended to be representative of.

comment.en: Relation from a Sample to the FeatureOfInterest that it is intended to be representative of.

definition.value: Relation linking an act of Sampling to the Sampler (sampling device or entity) that made it.

comment.en: Relation linking an act of Sampling to the Sampler (sampling device or entity) that made it.

definition.value: Relation between a Sampler (sampling device or entity) and the Sampling act it performed.

comment.en: Relation between a Sampler (sampling device or entity) and the Sampling act it performed.

definition.value: Relation between a Procedure (an algorithm, procedure or method) and an entity that implements that Procedure in some executable way.

example.value: For example, the relationship between a scientific measuring Procedure and a sensor that senses via that Procedure.

comment.en: Relation between a Procedure (an algorithm, procedure or method) and an entity that implements that Procedure in some executable way.

definition.value: Relation between a Platform and a Sensor, Actuator, Sampler, or Platform, hosted or mounted on it.

comment.en: Relation between a Platform and a Sensor, Actuator, Sampler, or Platform, hosted or mounted on it.

definition.value: Relation between a Procedure and an Input to it.

comment.en: Relation between a Procedure and an Input to it.

definition.value: Relation between a Procedure and an Output of it.

comment.en: Relation between a Procedure and an Output of it.
The accuracy of an entity.

definition.value: Relation between an Observation and the Stimulus that originated it.

comment.en: Relation between an Observation and the Stimulus that originated it.

definition.value: A relation between an Observation and the entity whose quality was observed, or between an Actuation and the entity whose property was modified, or between an act of Sampling and the entity that was sampled.

example.value: For example, in an Observation of the weight of a person, the FeatureOfInterest is the person and the property is its weight.

comment.en: A relation between an Observation and the entity whose quality was observed, or between an Actuation and the entity whose property was modified, or between an act of Sampling and the entity that was sampled.

definition.value: Relation between a Platform and a Deployment, meaning that the deployedSystems of the Deployment are hosted on the Platform.

example.value: For example, a relation between a buoy and a deployment of several Sensors.

comment.en: Relation between a Platform and a Deployment, meaning that the deployedSystems of the Deployment are hosted on the Platform.

definition.value: Relation linking an Observation to the property that was observed. The ObservableProperty should be a property of the FeatureOfInterest (linked by hasFeatureOfInterest) of this Observation.

comment.en: Relation linking an Observation to the property that was observed. The ObservableProperty should be a property of the FeatureOfInterest (linked by hasFeatureOfInterest) of this Observation.

definition.value: Relation linking an Observation or Actuation or act of Sampling and a Result or Sample.

comment.en: Relation linking an Observation or Actuation or act of Sampling and a Result or Sample.

definition.value: A relation to link to a re-usable Procedure used in making an Observation, an Actuation, or a Sample, typically through a Sensor, Actuator or Sampler.

comment.en: A relation to link to a re-usable Procedure used in making an Observation, an Actuation, or a Sample, typically through a Sensor, Actuator or Sampler.

definition.value: Relation between an Observation and the Sensor which made the Observation.

comment.en: Relation between an Observation and the Sensor which made the Observation.

definition.value: A relation from a Stimulus to the Property that the Stimulus is serving as a proxy for.

example.value: For example, the expansion of quicksilver is a stimulus that serves as a proxy for some temperature property. An increase or decrease in the velocity of spinning cups on a wind sensor is serving as a proxy for the wind speed.

comment.en: A relation from a Stimulus to the Property that the Stimulus is serving as a proxy for.

definition.value: Relation linking an Observation to the property that was observed. The ObservableProperty should be a property of the FeatureOfInterest (linked by hasFeatureOfInterest) of this Observation.

comment.en: Relation linking an Observation to the property that was observed. The ObservableProperty should be a property of the FeatureOfInterest (linked by hasFeatureOfInterest) of this Observation.

definition.value: Relation between an ObservableProperty and the Sensor able to observe it.

comment.en: Relation between an ObservableProperty and the Sensor able to observe it.

definition.value: Relation from a System to a SystemCapability describing the capabilities of the System under certain Conditions.

comment.en: Relation from a System to a SystemCapability describing the capabilities of the System under certain Conditions.

preferredNamespaceUri.value: Identifies an absolute position within a deployment

definition.value: Describes the prevailing environmental conditions for SystemCapabilites, OperatingRanges and SurvivalRanges.

example.value: Used for example to say that a sensor has a particular accuracy in particular conditions.

comment.en: Describes the prevailing environmental conditions for SystemCapabilites, OperatingRanges and SurvivalRanges.

definition.value: Relation from an OperatingRange of a System to a OperatingPropery describing the operating range of the System.

comment.en: Relation from an OperatingRange of a System to a OperatingPropery describing the operating range of the System.
A relation to a re-usable system that computed the observation.
Quantitative anglue result value for axis-angle representation.

definition.value: Relation between a System and its component parts.

comment.en: Relation between a System and its component parts.

definition.value: Relation between a System and its component parts.

comment.en: Relation between a System and its component parts.

definition.value: Relation from a System to a SurvivalRange.

comment.en: Relation from a System to a SurvivalRange.

definition.value: Relation from a System to an OperatingRange describing the normal operating environment of the System.

comment.en: Relation from a System to an OperatingRange describing the normal operating environment of the System.

definition.value: Relation between a Sensor, Actuator, Sampler, or Platform, and the Platform that it is mounted on or hosted by.

comment.en: Relation between a Sensor, Actuator, Sampler, or Platform, and the Platform that it is mounted on or hosted by.

definition.value: Relation between an Observation and the Stimulus that originated it.

comment.en: Relation between an Observation and the Stimulus that originated it.

definition.value: Relation between an entity that implements a Procedure in some executable way and the Procedure (an algorithm, procedure or method).

example.value: For example, the relationship between a sensor and the scientific measuring Procedure via which it senses.

comment.en: Relation between an entity that implements a Procedure in some executable way and the Procedure (an algorithm, procedure or method).

definition.value: Relation between a System and a Deployment, recording that the System is deployed in that Deployment.

comment.en: Relation between a System and a Deployment, recording that the System is deployed in that Deployment.

definition.value: A relation from a Sensor to the Stimulus that the Sensor detects. The Stimulus itself will be serving as a proxy for some ObservableProperty.

comment.en: A relation from a Sensor to the Stimulus that the Sensor detects. The Stimulus itself will be serving as a proxy for some ObservableProperty.

definition.value: A relation from a Stimulus to the Property that the Stimulus is serving as a proxy for.

example.value: For example, the expansion of quicksilver is a stimulus that serves as a proxy for some temperature property. An increase or decrease in the velocity of spinning cups on a wind sensor is serving as a proxy for the wind speed.

comment.en: A relation from a Stimulus to the Property that the Stimulus is serving as a proxy for.
Property that links a feature of interest to a unique acceleration property related to this feature.
Indicates the velocity of a feature of interest.
comment.nl: Duid de snelheid van een object aan.

definition.value: Relation between a Property and the entity it belongs to.

comment.en: Relation between a Property and the entity it belongs to.

definition.value: Relation between a Deployment and the Platform on which the Systems are deployed.

comment.en: Relation between a Deployment and the Platform on which the Systems are deployed.

definition.value: Relation between a Deployment and a deployed System.

comment.en: Relation between a Deployment and a deployed System.

definition.value: Relation between a Procedure and an Output of it.

comment.en: Relation between a Procedure and an Output of it.

definition.value: Relation between a Procedure and an Input to it.

comment.en: Relation between a Procedure and an Input to it.

definition.value: Relation between a Sensor and an Observation made by the Sensor.

comment.en: Relation between a Sensor and an Observation made by the Sensor.

definition.value: Relation between a Sensor and an ObservableProperty that it is capable of sensing.

comment.en: Relation between a Sensor and an ObservableProperty that it is capable of sensing.

definition.value: A relation between some aspect of an entity and a Property.

example.value: For example, from a Sensor to the properties it can observe; from an Actuator to the properties it can act on; from a Deployment to the properties it was installed to observe or act on; from a SystemCapability to the Property the capability is described for.

comment.en: A relation between some aspect of an entity and a Property.

definition.value: A relation from a Sensor to the Stimulus that the Sensor detects. The Stimulus itself will be serving as a proxy for some ObservableProperty.

comment.en: A relation from a Sensor to the Stimulus that the Sensor detects. The Stimulus itself will be serving as a proxy for some ObservableProperty.

definition.value: Relation linking an Observation to the adjudged quality of the Result. This is complimentary to the SystemCapability information recorded for the Sensor that made the Observation.

comment.en: Relation linking an Observation to the adjudged quality of the Result. This is complimentary to the SystemCapability information recorded for the Sensor that made the Observation.

definition.value: Relation from a System to a SystemCapability describing the capabilities of the System under certain Conditions.

comment.en: Relation from a System to a SystemCapability describing the capabilities of the System under certain Conditions.

definition.value: Relation from an SystemCapability of a System to a SystemProperty describing the capabilities of the System.

comment.en: Relation from an SystemCapability of a System to a SystemProperty describing the capabilities of the System.

definition.value: Relation from an SystemCapability of a System to a SystemProperty describing the capabilities of the System.

comment.en: Relation from an SystemCapability of a System to a SystemProperty describing the capabilities of the System.

definition.value: Describes the prevailing environmental conditions for SystemCapabilites, OperatingRanges and SurvivalRanges.

example.value: Used for example to say that a sensor has a particular accuracy in particular conditions.

comment.en: Describes the prevailing environmental conditions for SystemCapabilites, OperatingRanges and SurvivalRanges.

example.value: A person can have a relative distance to another feature of interest. When a feature is moving (i.e. when the geometry changes based on time) the distance remains relative to the feature and not the geometry at a specific point in time.

comment.en: Indicates a relative position to be relative to another feature of interest.

definition.value: Relation from a System to a SurvivalRange.

comment.en: Relation from a System to a SurvivalRange.

definition.value: Describes the prevailing environmental conditions for SystemCapabilites, OperatingRanges and SurvivalRanges.

example.value: Used for example to say that a sensor has a particular accuracy in particular conditions.

comment.en: Describes the prevailing environmental conditions for SystemCapabilites, OperatingRanges and SurvivalRanges.

definition.value: A relation between some aspect of an entity and a Property.

example.value: For example, from a Sensor to the properties it can observe; from an Actuator to the properties it can act on; from a Deployment to the properties it was installed to observe or act on; from a SystemCapability to the Property the capability is described for.

comment.en: A relation between some aspect of an entity and a Property.

definition.value: Relation from a System to an OperatingRange describing the normal operating environment of the System.

comment.en: Relation from a System to an OperatingRange describing the normal operating environment of the System.

definition.value: Relation from an OperatingRange of a System to a OperatingPropery describing the operating range of the System.

comment.en: Relation from an OperatingRange of a System to a OperatingPropery describing the operating range of the System.

definition.value: Relation from a SurvivalRange of a System to a SurvivalProperty describing the survival range of the System.

definition.value: Relation linking an Actuation to the Actuator that made that Actuation.

comment.en: Relation linking an Actuation to the Actuator that made that Actuation.

definition.value: Relation linking an Observation or Actuation or act of Sampling and a Result or Sample.

comment.en: Relation linking an Observation or Actuation or act of Sampling and a Result or Sample.

definition.value: A relation between an Observation and the entity whose quality was observed, or between an Actuation and the entity whose property was modified, or between an act of Sampling and the entity that was sampled.

example.value: For example, in an Observation of the weight of a person, the FeatureOfInterest is the person and the property is its weight.

comment.en: A relation between an Observation and the entity whose quality was observed, or between an Actuation and the entity whose property was modified, or between an act of Sampling and the entity that was sampled.

definition.value: Relation between an Actuation and the property of a FeatureOfInterest it is acting upon.

example.value: In the activity (Actuation) of automatically closing a window if the temperature in a room drops below 20 degrees Celsius, the property on which the Actuator acts upon is the state of the window as it changes from being open to being closed.

comment.en: Relation between an Actuation and the property of a FeatureOfInterest it is acting upon.

definition.value: Relation between an Actuator and the Actuation it has made.

comment.en: Relation between an Actuator and the Actuation it has made.

definition.value: A relation between some aspect of an entity and a Property.

example.value: For example, from a Sensor to the properties it can observe; from an Actuator to the properties it can act on; from a Deployment to the properties it was installed to observe or act on; from a SystemCapability to the Property the capability is described for.

comment.en: A relation between some aspect of an entity and a Property.

definition.value: Relation between a FeatureOfInterest and the Sample used to represent it.

comment.en: Relation between a FeatureOfInterest and the Sample used to represent it.

definition.value: Relation between an entity and a Property of that entity.

comment.en: Relation between an entity and a Property of that entity.

definition.value: Relation between an ActuatableProperty of a FeatureOfInterest and an Actuation changing its state.

example.value: In the activity (Actuation) of automatically closing a window if the temperature in a room drops below 20 degrees Celsius, the property on which the Actuator acts upon is the state of the window as it changes from being open to being closed.

comment.en: Relation between an ActuatableProperty of a FeatureOfInterest and an Actuation changing its state.

definition.value: A relation to link to a re-usable Procedure used in making an Observation, an Actuation, or a Sample, typically through a Sensor, Actuator or Sampler.

comment.en: A relation to link to a re-usable Procedure used in making an Observation, an Actuation, or a Sample, typically through a Sensor, Actuator or Sampler.

definition.value: The result time is the instant of time when the Observation, Actuation or Sampling activity was completed.

comment.en: The result time is the instant of time when the Observation, Actuation or Sampling activity was completed.
Roll is the rotation around the y-axis with respect to the object the roll applies to.

definition.value: The simple value of an Observation or Actuation or act of Sampling.

example.value: For instance, the values 23 or true.

comment.en: The simple value of an Observation or Actuation or act of Sampling.
